meanings.definition: A person who buys goods from manufacturers and sells them to retailers.
meanings.sent1: The jobber delivered boxes of clothes to the store.
meanings.sent2: The jobber stocked the shelves with new products.
meanings.sent3: The jobber accidentally sold winter coats in the middle of summer!
meanings.sent4: The jobber was like a middleman connecting the factory to the shop.
meanings.sent5: The jobber's role was crucial in getting products to the customers.

meanings.definition: A person who works by the job.
meanings.sent1: The jobber completed each task quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The jobber was hired to paint the fence.
meanings.sent3: The jobber finished all the work before lunchtime!
meanings.sent4: The jobber's dedication to each project was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The jobber's skills made him a sought-after worker in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A person who turns a public office to private advantage.
meanings.sent1: The jobber used his position for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The jobber exploited his role for profit.
meanings.sent3: The jobber found a clever way to benefit from his job!
meanings.sent4: The jobber's actions were like turning public resources into his own treasure.
meanings.sent5: The jobber's corruption as a public servant was eventually exposed.
